qas.question: In which year did Feynman orate the Caltech commencement speech?
Which topic did Feynman's commencement speech at Caltech center around?
What did Feyman tell the class that they must not do to themselves?
Which year did Feynman miss the Caltech commencement speech?
Which topic did Feynman's commencement speech at Caltech avoid?
What is the science Feynman understood best considered?
What did Feynman tell the class that they must do to themselves?

context: In <a0_0><b4_0>1974<b4_0/><a0_0/>, Feynman delivered the Caltech commencement address on the topic of <a1_0><b5_0>cargo cult science<b5_0/><a1_0/>, which has the semblance of science, but is only <a2_0><b6_0>pseudoscience<b6_0/><a2_0/> due to a lack of "a kind of scientific integrity, a principle of scientific thought that corresponds to a kind of utter honesty" on the part of the scientist. He instructed the graduating class that "The first principle is that you must not <a3_0><b7_0>fool yourself<b7_0/><a3_0/>—and you are the easiest person to fool. So you have to be very careful about that. After you've not fooled yourself, it's easy not to fool other scientists. You just have to be honest in a conventional way after that."
